newsitem.title: USA: N.J. Turnpike eyes $700 mln bond sale in Q1 1998.
newsitem.headline: N.J. Turnpike eyes $700 mln bond sale in Q1 1998.

text.p: The New Jersey Turnpike Authority may sell as much as $700 million of bonds in the first quarter of 1998, including a possible $300 million refunding, the agency's executive director said Thursday.
Edward Gross said in a telephone interview that proceeding with the $400 million new money component hinges on an environmental permit now under consideration by state regulators.

The catalyst for getting the new money deal underway will be approval from the state's Department of Environmental Protection for a $290 million project connecting the Turnpike to Route 1 in Middlesex County.
A hearing involving the project is set for June 10, Gross said.
Other bond-financed plans contributing to the $400 million need include moving the Turnpike's Interchange 1 toll plaza, and various bridge redecking and revitalization projects.

The size of the refunding component would depend on market conditions at the time of the sale. Gross said the $300 million estimate represents a "modest" refunding of a portion of the agency's $2.5 billion in outstanding debt. ((--Steven Dickson, 212-859-1652))
